resources.string: \ Sudoku is a logic-based number placement puzzle. Starting with a partially completed 9x9 grid, the objective is to fill the grid so that each row, each column, and each of the 3x3 boxes (also called blocks) contains the digits 1 to 9 exactly once.

\ 1) I have no images/icons/graphics I didn\'t design myself.\n 2) I got inspiration for my readFile() from: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/14376807/how-to-read-write-string-from-a-file-in-android.\n 3) I didn\'t ask anyone for help.
Need 18 letters or less to dump!
Need less than 21 letters in your rack
Game over from having negative points!

Online Help 1:
 http://stackoverflow.com/questions/363681/generating-random-integers-in-a-range-with-java 
 Online Help 2:
 http://stackoverflow.com/questions/9030268/set-visibility-in-menu-programatically-android 
 Other help suggestions came from TA's Ameya and Zhongjie.

Use your letters rack to make as many words as possible by connecting letters together! \n Just tap a tile with your finger to open your rack, and tap on a letter to place the letter on the rack. \n When you make a word, you have 10 seconds to make another word before time runs out and it\'s game over!

Got a lot of help using TA's GCMSample code: 
 https://www.dropbox.com/s/1ca278zojj3zkqj/NUMAD15S-GCMSampleDemo.zip?dl=0 
 Also the ParseSample code from Github: 
 https://github.com/zhongjieM/ParseSample

\ The trickiest part of the project to construct that makes us think "are we going to be able to do that?" is setting up the connection between players through their contacts (i.e. their friends list). Essentially how we're thinking this will work is: 
 1) When a player opens the app, using ContactsContract.Profile (and the "READ_PROFILE", "READ_CONTACTS" permissions), 
 we store their display_name (unique to their phone) in a database (Parse at this point). It's viable because this app could only be downloaded 
 from the Google Play Store, for which they need an account.
 2) When a user clicks on the menu button to go to their friends board, we're constructing it so that we pull from their contacts list and 
 cross-examine the contact names with the display names gathered previously. Those results will be the only "friends" we display in a dialog. 
 (we may store phone numbers instead because they're very highly unique, but I thought this would do for demonstration purposes).
 3) When a user taps on a friend in the ListView-like structure result, they'll be taken to that friends food board, i.e. pulling lots of data from 
 a database that simulates the appearance of "travelling to their friends board".

The most nutritious game ever!

 Food Crunch is brand new diet app that lets you track your daily eating habits and see your meal progress from week to week!

 Going to eat a chocolate bar or a banana? Apple pie or avocados? Pin the food on your food board!

 Food Crunch is 100% FREE to play.

 HOW IT WORKS: Simply download the app and tell us your average meal eating time and we'll take you to your food board of the week, divided into tiles and by weekday. Tap a tile to open your phone camera, and snap a photo of your food, after which that food will be in that tile.

 Whether your goal is to lose weight or simply track your eating habits, Food Crunch has you covered. You'll be heading healthier before you know it.

 FEATURES:

 - Rankings to compare your eating habits to your friends.
 - A Notification System to send a helpful reminder at your breakfast, lunch or dinner times to pin your food on your food board.
 - One button press to view next weeks, or your previous weeks food boards.
 - Game Achievements.
